fields.description:
JSON object used to pass env values to tools.

For example the value of message below: 
    { "message": "Hello, World" }
can be accessed in a tool like so: 
    def main():
        print(otto.env.message)

Note: this overrides env values set in Otto Settings > Global Env
fields.label: Env

fields.description:
Same tool can be used more than once by using different names and different env values.

For example: a search tool can be parametrized with different URLs (using Env) and be given different names using Slug
fields.label: Slug (Override)
